articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Samira, a mother of two, yearns for her old life when she was an Arabic teacher and had a comfortable home - before the attack by Hamas on Israel a year ago plunged Gaza into suffering and chaos.
articles.title: Hamas faces dissent in Gaza as heavy toll weakens support for war, a year on

articles.author: Oleksandr Kozhukhar, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces have entered the outskirts of the eastern Ukraine frontline city of Toretsk, Ukraine's military said late on Monday, less than a week after the fall of the nearby bastion town of Vuhledar.
articles.title: Russian forces reach another key frontline city, Ukraine's military says

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russia said on Tuesday that it still had an emergency hotline with the United States and the NATO military alliance to deflate crises as nuclear risks rise amid the gravest confrontation between Moscow and West since the depths of the Cold War.
articles.title: Russia says emergency hotlines with US and NATO remain as nuclear risks rise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam and France have officially upgraded their relations to a "comprehensive strategic partnership", Vietnam's highest level, during a visit by Vietnamese President To Lam to Paris.
articles.title: Vietnam upgrades ties with France to highest level

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Southeast Asian leaders will meet in Laos this week as Myanmar's civil war and mounting tensions in the South China Sea risk corroding the ASEAN grouping's central role in the region.
articles.title: Myanmar and South China Sea to test ASEAN relevance in upcoming summit

articles.author: Daniel Trotta, Brad Brooks
articles.description: The densely populated west coast of Florida braced for landfall on Wednesday.
articles.title: Monster hurricane Milton threatens an already battered Florida

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah deputy leader Naim Qassem said in comments broadcast on Tuesday that his movement supports efforts to reach a ceasefire for Lebanon, but for the first time omitted any mention of a Gaza truce deal as a pre-condition to halting the group's fire on Israel.
articles.title: Hezbollah deputy chief backs Lebanon ceasefire efforts, omits mention of Gaza deal

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) trailed in two provincial elections as votes were counted on Tuesday, TV channels said, a fresh setback after it failed to win a clear majority in the general election this year.
articles.title: India PM Modi's BJP trails in vote count in two provincial elections, TV says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain targeted Russian troops involved in using chemical weapons on the battlefield in Ukraine with sanctions on Tuesday, accusing Russia of "cruel and inhumane tactics".
articles.title: UK sanctions Russian troops for chemical weapons use in Ukraine
